headline: Greek Yogurt Oatmeal
description: Greek yogurt oatmeal with bananas, strawberry jam, and peanut butter is quick and easy to prepare in the microwave for busy weekday mornings.
name: Greek Yogurt Oatmeal

recipeInstructions.text: Combine oats, banana, cinnamon, and salt in a microwave-safe bowl; add water and stir. Cook in microwave until water is absorbed, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir to evenly distribute cinnamon; let stand until slightly cooled, about 3 minutes.
Spoon Greek yogurt, strawberry jam, and peanut butter over oatmeal; stir.

review.reviewBody: Wow this was good and filling. I used raisins instead of banana. Going to try some maple syrup to sweeten it a little next time, but really not needed
I normally would have passed this by as Iâ€™m not an oatmeal fan. However, it was very tasty! I swapped the strawberry jam for fresh raspberries as that is what I had.
I omitted the peanut butter. Maybe it was the greek yogurt I used but it wasn't my favorite. I will try different yogurt next time.
I made this for breakfast and thought that it tasted pretty good. I used Blackberry jelly instead of the strawberry because I had it on hand. Lots of protein in this meal.
a little too much like peanut butter and jelly oatmeal for my taste

Wow this came out alot better than I thought it would. I thought it would come but out mushy and soupy but it didn't. My CORRECTIONS for this recipe; 1/4 cup raisins instead of 1/2 banana, 3/4 cup water instead of 1 cup, and 1.5 tbsp of blueberry jam.

Wow, I was hesitant to make this. It seemed like too many ingredients for my usual boring oatmeal but it was delicious! I didn't have bananas so I used blueberries. No strawberry jelly so I used a bit of grape (strawberry would have been better). I also added a bit of local honey. Great way to start the day with a healthy, easy recipe! Thank you for sharing it.
